record.id: field.name="end.of.day.window.interval" and file.name="slocatalog" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: end.of.day.window.interval
record.file.name: slocatalog

brief.brief: The amount of time before the actual end of business day, which does not count as part of that day for processing the Process Target.

detail.detail: Service Manager uses this value together with the schedule specified for the SLT. For example, if the end of business day is 5:00 pm based on the schedule of the SLT, and the End of business day buffer is 2 hours, an interaction that is registered before 3:00 pm must be handled in that business day, but interactions registered after 3:00 pm can be handled in the next business day.
If no value is specified here, the end of business day specified in the schedule of the SLT is used.
The format for specifying the buffer is dd hh:mm:ss. For example, 5 hours can be specified as 05:00:00 and 2 days and 3 hours can be specified as 2 03:00:00.
